{"step_by_step_thinking": "Obstructive sleep apnoea is characterized by frequent episodes of upper airway collapse during sleep. This is usually due to factors such as obesity, advanced age, male sex, family history, craniofacial abnormalities, smoking and alcohol consumption. None of the options provided directly cause obstructive sleep apnoea. However, bilateral TMJ ankylosis could potentially lead to difficulty in breathing due to limited mouth opening, which could indirectly contribute to the development of obstructive sleep apnoea.", "answer_choice": "D. Bilateral TMJ ankylosis"}
